p: In the wet snowbeds, some species mostly associated to typical snowbeds, such as Sibbaldia procumbens, increase in frequency (+55.6%, P‐value = 0.019), while Juncus triglumis, Saxifraga androsacea, and Gentiana bavarica, three species growing in wet snowbeds, decrease in terms of mean cover (−26.3%, P‐value = 0.008; −18.4%, P‐value = 0.026; −15%, P‐value = 0.047, respectively).
